ygData.subject: Re: TWINKING-- a discussion
ygData.msgSnippet: ... has tackled before:: In the beginning, there was loot. And it was good. Then there was phat lewt twinkies. And it pissed me the hell
ygData.messageBody:
::Nukai cracks his knuckles to tackle a topic he
has tackled before::<br><br>In the beginning, there
was loot. <br>And it was good.<br>Then there was phat
lewt twinkies.<br>And it pissed me the hell
off.<br><br>I share feelings with you about the level 50 guy
twinking his level 5 druid. I also find the tale of the
level 1 lambent-covered bard quite humorous. Now I will
begin with my spiel on it all.<br>I confess. I have
twinked my characters, as well as donated some to my
brother's character. Note: My bro really did lose his
stuff, all of it. He was level 16 when I helped him out
with a FS longsword and a fair amount of banded mail.
Since then I have assisted him in getting his Ivy tunic
(cause I got some braided Ivy cords out of the deal!)
And he promptly returned my mail to me. So this is
more of a loan. My characters on the other hand are
more a model for a certain kind of item or armor. Such
as I created a wizard so I could see someone wear my
flowing black robe and water crystal staff, he's level 2
but I like him. I have a shaman level 4 with totemic
gauntlets (never try to do totemic quests for money, you
get stuck with the item) and a harpoon of the depths
(a trade for a pair of gem inlaid gauntlets). My
warrior troll I have played straight up to level 9, and
only now am I beginning to buy him some armor, but
this is a style matter. I am hooking him up with
red-dyed fine plate, I hope it looks good. He gathered the
fungus for the dyes, I am only assisting in the
financial department.<br>You will always be pissed at
someone lower level than you with better stuff. I was, in
fact I still am. Every time I see a druid lower (I'm
talking level 5 or 6 here even) than me with runed
mithril bracers, I want to reach out and smack them. But
I get over it, the reason they are twinked is
because they have a higher up that went through all the
rights of passage (unless they had a friend power level
a druid to 34 and raised the cash through
teleports). Don't hate them because they are twinkies, hate
them for being bastards (such as the camp-stealing lvl
50, mentioned earlier). <br>There are good twinks out
there, but it all depends on the player. I have grouped
before with both rising primaries and decked-out twinks.
As long as they know what they are doing, I am okay
with things. I just don't want to hear "Train to zone!
Werebat is after me!" from a level 4 paladin wearing some
kickass armor wielding a ghoulbane. (For those of you
unfamiliar with Unrest, a werebat is still blue to a 35
druid, something a real level 4 pally would never go
near).<br>Anyways, don't hate me because I twink up some of my
people.<br>Nukai Oakenwulf
